title: Manchester City hoping to complete £30million summer swoop for Roma defender Antonio Rudiger
text:
Sport Manchester City hoping to complete £30million summer swoop for Roma defender Antonio Rudiger Pep Guardiola has identified Germany international Rudiger as one of his top summer defensive targets as he looks to rebuild City’s crumbling backline Share Rudiger is on City's radar (Photo: Rex Features) Share Get     
Manchester City are hoping to complete a £30million deal to sign Roma defender Antonio Rudiger. 
Pep Guardiola has identified Germany international Rudiger as one of his top summer defensive targets as he looks to rebuild City’s crumbling backline. 
City have had scouts at every one of Rudiger’s games in recent months and are looking to meet with representatives of the 24-year-old as early as next week. 
Chelsea are also in the hunt for Rudiger and almost signed him last summer, before a knee injury suffered by the defender scuppered the proposed deal. 
But City are determined to beat them to the signature of Rudiger, one of the most highly-rated young defenders in Europe and one they see as the ideal long-term central defensive parter for John Stones. Rudiger is rated at £30m (Photo: AFP) City are desperate for defensive reinforcements (Photo: Getty) 
Rudiger’s versatility in being able to play right-back as well as centre-back gives him even more value to Guardiola, who is looking for defenders who can adapt to a variety of roles. 
City boss Guardiola knows Rudiger well from his time at Bayern Munich, when the defender was playing for Stuttgart, before making the switch to Roma in a deal worth around £8m. 
Guardiola knows he must embark on a defensive rebuild, with City’s humiliating last 16 Champions League exit to Monaco confirming the need for a complete overhaul at the back. 
Skipper Vincent Kompany is likely to be offloaded this summer, with Guardiola unwilling to trust the 30-year-old given his ongoing injury and fitness issues. 
Bacary Sagna, Gael Clichy and Pablo Zabaleta are all out of contract this summer and unlikely to be offered extensions, meaning City are in the market for at least four new defenders. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
